bug.author: castorfou
bug.description:
Describe the bug ImportError when running for the 1st time after a fresh pandas-profiling install with a very simple code. To Reproduce conda install -c conda-forge pandas-profiling #%% test pandas-profiling import pandas as pd import pandas_profiling wells=pd.read_csv('wells.csv', index_col=0) wells.profile_report(style={'full_width':True})
<denchmark-link:https://file.io/fOIwb5>https://file.io/fOIwb5</denchmark-link> as wells.csv Code: Preferably, use this code format: """ Test for issue ImportError cannot import name 'register_matplotlib_converters' from 'pandas.plotting': https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling/issues/XXX """ import pandas as pd import pandas_profiling
wells=pd.read_csv('wells.csv', index_col=0) wells.profile_report(style={'full_width':True}) Version information: Version information is essential in reproducing and resolving bugs. Please report:
Python version: 3.7.3 Environment: Spyder pip:

comments.comment: The version information seems correct. This is most likely not a problem with pandas-profiling itself. You could uninstall pandas/matplotlib and restart the environment. Does it work then? Related: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/19340>pandas-dev/pandas#19340</denchmark-link>
fixed by just restarting the environment, thanks!

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/castorfou>@castorfou</denchmark-link> - can you provide the instructions to "restart" the env. I tried to deactivate it and then activate it again, but the issue persists.

@castorfou - can you provide the instructions to "restart" the env. I tried to deactivate it and then activate it again, but the issue persists.
He means "restart jupyter"
For me, I needed to either run the jupyter notebook from the same terminal where I upgraded pandas-profiling, or open a new terminal window.
